intro: Hoffmannseggia burchellii, commonly known as the Burchell's rock cress, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically forms dense mats on rocky or sandy soils. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in spring. Its leaves are narrow and often have a waxy coating, helping it retain moisture in arid environments. Hoffmannseggia burchellii is native to southern Africa and is adapted to thrive in dry, rocky habitats.
